page.title: 05KNIGHTS HOSPITALLERS
page.content:
THE PRECEPTORY OF POLING
Taken over in the war of the roses, the estate was given to the Earl of Arundel in 1418, and the knights were thrown out. Sir Harry Johnson took over the house while he ruled Uganda. The house has got three sections. The end section was a chapel with a large east window which is now bricked up. Outside the chapel was a large burial ground in which a grave slab, which is now positioned on the dining room wall, was found. Before the war there were four separate farms but now there is only one in the original six and a half acres of land. In the garden there is a well which used to be the main water supply for the preceptory.
